title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
China's severe Covid-19 restrictions, which for two years aided the country's pandemic rebound by keeping the virus outside its borders, are now emerging as the largest threat to its growth.

---

Apollo is considering participating in a bid for Twitter, according to people familiar with the matter, after Musk's $43 billion bid put the company in play.

---

Bank of America reported a 12% drop in first-quarter profit, marking the end to an underwhelming earnings season for the largest U.S. banks.

---

U.S. stocks edged lower, with the S&P 500 slipping 0.02% and the Dow and Nasdaq both losing 0.1%. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note rose.

---

Tesla was probed by the EEOC before California sued the company over alleged racial discrimination, according to a legal filing.

---

Union organizers won the right to hold an election at an Amazon facility in New Jersey, marking the newest union push targeting the company.

---

J&J will pay $99 million to settle a lawsuit in West Virginia that alleges the company helped fuel the state's opioid crisis.

---

Schwab shares fell 9.4% after the firm reported a drop in revenue and missed analysts' expectations.

---

Deezer, a Spotify competitor, is merging with a blank-check company, aiming to go public at a valuation of about $1.13 billion.
